com.ecs.utils
Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.ecs.utils.FileUtils
public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object

The class contains a number of File & Properties related utility methods.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gordon Sandeman

public static int deleteTree(java.io.File node)
Deletes the passed File node. If the passed File is a directory all sub-directories and files are deleted as well.

Parameters:

Returns:

Parameters:

Returns:
int giving number of files deleted, if the passed folder name is not a folder or an error occurs it returns -1

downloadFromHttpToDir

public static java.lang.String downloadFromHttpToDir(java.lang.String source,
                                                     java.lang.String targetDir)
Download a file from a Http source into a target directory.

Parameters:
source - URL to the source file
targetDir - Directory in which the source file should be saved
Returns:
Fully qualified path to the downloaded file

downloadFromHttpToDir

public static java.lang.String downloadFromHttpToDir(java.lang.String source,
                                                     java.lang.String targetDir,
                                                     java.lang.String filename)
Download a file, with a user defined name, from a Http source into a target directory. The downloaded file will use the passed filename plus the document extension used by the source file.

Parameters:
source - URL to the source file
targetDir - Directory in which the source file should be saved
filename - Name under which the downloaded file should be saved
Returns:
Fully qualified path to the downloaded file

readBytesToFile

public static java.lang.String readBytesToFile(java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream baos,
                                               java.lang.String extension)
Reads a ByteArrayOutputStream to a file. The file is created in the user's temp area and has the extension defined by the extension parameter. If no extension is passed none will be set. The function returns the full path to the saved file.

Parameters:
baos - ByteArrayOutputStream to be written to file
extension - Optional extension applied to the saved file
Returns:
Fully qualified path to the saved file

readBytesToFile

public static java.lang.String readBytesToFile(java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream baos,
                                               java.io.File filename)
Reads a ByteArrayOutputStream to a file. The function returns the full path to the saved file (filename.

Parameters:
baos - ByteArrayOutputStream to be written to file
filename - File content should be stored to
Returns:
Fully qualified path to the saved file

Reads a file to a ByteArrayOutputStream.

Parameters:
filename -
Returns:
ByteArrayOutputStream holding file content
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If content does not exist

canLock

public static boolean canLock(java.io.File file)
Checks whether the passed file can be locked exclusively.

Parameters:
file - File whose lock state should be checked
Returns:
Flag indicating whether an exclusive lock can be established

getAllSub

public static java.util.TreeSet getAllSub(java.io.File root,
                                          java.lang.String prefix)
Returns an (alpha) ordered fully qualified directory structure for all files/sub-dirs of the passed root directory. Optionally if a prefix is passed this is added as a prefix to the stored qualified directory. If prefix is null then each returned filename is returned fully qualified. Note that the directory path is always returned with UNIX file separator notation of "/".

Parameters:
root - Directory root
prefix - Prefix added to the stored directory path
Returns:
TreeSet containing the ordered file/directory structure

getAllSubdirs

public static java.util.TreeSet getAllSubdirs(java.io.File root,
                                              java.lang.String prefix)
Returns an (alpha) ordered fully qualified directory structure for all subdirectories of the passed root directory. Optionally if a prefix is passed this is added as a prefix to the stored qualified directory. If prefix is null then each returned filename is returned fully qualified. Note that the directory path is always returned with UNIX file separator notation of "/".

Parameters:
root - Directory root
prefix - Prefix added to the stored directory path
Returns:
TreeSet containing the ordered directory structure

getAllStampedSubfiles

public static java.util.TreeMap getAllStampedSubfiles(java.io.File root,
                                                      java.lang.String prefix)
Returns an (alpha) ordered fully qualified list of all files in the passed root directory and all its subdirectories with the last modified time of each file held as a value against the filename key. Optionally if a prefix is passed this is added as a prefix to the stored qualified file. If prefix is null then each returned filename is returned fully qualified.

Parameters:
root - Directory root
prefix - Prefix added to the stored directory path
Returns:
TreeSet containing the ordered directory structure

getAllSubfiles

public static java.util.TreeSet getAllSubfiles(java.io.File root,
                                               java.lang.String prefix)
Returns an (alpha) ordered fully qualified list of all files in the passed root directory and all its subdirectories. Optionally if a prefix is passed this is added as a prefix to the stored qualified file. If prefix is null then each returned filename is returned fully qualified.

Parameters:
root - Directory root
prefix - Prefix added to the stored directory path
Returns:
TreeSet containing the ordered directory structure
